website_summaries.verdict: A lightweight option for flexible tube cutting made of PEX plastic.
pros: Stands out for its ergonomic design, which makes it comfortable to hold for long periods of time
Sharp edge is great for softer tubing
cons: Not designed for metal tube or pipe cutting

customer_reviews.title: It’s a baby!
customer_reviews.text: Pictured above with my Ridgid 15 and a piece of 3/4” copper tubing seated inside. I bought this to cut 1/2” and 3/4” copper in places where that Ridgid 15 will not fit. It takes a few more turns to cut pipe vs. the larger and much heavier cutter, but that was to be expected and is not a problem. A couple items of note to clarify conflicting info in the Q & A and Reviews sections: - The 104 does not come with a spare cutting wheel. - The 104 does not have notched rollers. What else can I say? I love all my Ridgid wrenches and cutters.
customer_reviews.author: Pet Deposit

customer_reviews.title: Close-In Pipe Cutter - up to 3/4" ID or 15/16" OD - Made in USA
customer_reviews.text: Many reviews by others. For use in close -in or tight, but need about 1/2" on both sides of cutting blade for cutter to "spin" to score & cut a pipe. Made in USA, which wasn't expected, but great ! Packaging says for hard & soft copper, brass, aluminum and PVC. Implies steel (like EMT) is not intended, but probably OK but will dull the blade. Blade is replaceable and part # is listed.
customer_reviews.author: Sui Lin Chee

customer_reviews.title: Great little cutter
customer_reviews.text: Great little tubing cutter. Works great for cutting new brake lines. I do wish seller would have sent the right one (I ordered the model 104, and got model 101) still worked for what I needed, and I got the model 101 for model 104 price...win on my part. Can’t go wrong with Ridgid products, lifetime warranty...I work in the oil field and am used to using the larger versions. Never had a problem with them, and have had warranty replacement from the local sales on several occasions.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Easy, clean, reliable.
customer_reviews.text: I have some copper water plumbing in my home's basement ceiling (1/2 inch and 3/4 inch) that I am modifying, and this guy does the job. It fits in tight spaces and makes nice, clean cuts. It does take a good 2 minutes to cut a pipe with a fair share of manual turning. And so if I had a lot of cuts to make in non-constricted areas, I'd likely use something else. But given expected limited use of this tool, it seems right for all of my applications. The blade is readily replaceable.
customer_reviews.author: Larns

customer_reviews.title: Cuts Copper pipe with ease and very few twists
customer_reviews.text: Bought and used to cut copper pipe when I replaced my water heater and switched to pex. I was surprised how well it cut. I thought I would be tightening and spinning this thing for hours but it only took a few twists. And comes with extra wheel cutters so it should last me forever! Makes a very clean, rounded edge cut. Would also highly recommend the shark bite deburing tool in conjunction with this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, precise tool.
customer_reviews.text: Pleasantly surprised. I have used cheaper versions before with poor results. This product provided a quick, even cut. Just don’t overtighten. Slow but sure is the best approach with this type of cutter. Interested to see how long it stays sharp. Since I just use it for home repair, I am guessing that it will last a lifetime.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie Burton

customer_reviews.title: RIDGID 32985 Model 104 Close Quarters works great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this compact cutter to cut some 3/4 inch copper pipe that I had to relocate in my main water line. The pipe was very close to the cellar wall with just enough clearance to use this cutter. It worked like a charm! I did a few practice cuts on some scrap I had then it was time to do the real thing. My advice is to take a couple of practice cuts first and take your time. Well worth the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Deron

customer_reviews.title: RIDGID 32985 Model 104 Close Quarters Tubing Cutter
customer_reviews.text: This is the best tubing cutter I've had in a quite a while. I kept buying Chinese made cutters that would not cut a clean line in PVC. This little jewel does. I wasn't aware it was made in the USA before I bought it, it beats the snot out of the Chinese ones I've had.
customer_reviews.author: AEinstein

customer_reviews.title: Terrible ring, very scratchy. Good for pipe cutting though.
customer_reviews.text: Popped it on a piece of EMT, and instantly made a noticeable incision without any pressure. Feels more solid and less "walky" than the cheaper stuff out there. I looked at generic lowest bidder made in china stuff at a local HW store and decided I wanted better. They didn't carry better, so I waited for a couple days for Amazon to get me a better product at the same price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazing Customer

customer_reviews.title: Supposed to have the spare cutter wheel, not included
customer_reviews.text: The package clearly says on the front that a spare cutter wheel is included. There is no spare. These packages were probably factory rejects because of this. If the cutter works as it's supposed to I'll probably keep it, but I could have bought it cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: SteveDC

customer_reviews.title: Excellent little tool
customer_reviews.text: This does the job perfect. I am cutting lines that are off the car, this little thing requires a few more turns that I initially expected, to get a clean cut. Either way it was no big deal and the cuts are clean and sharp.
customer_reviews.author: ETHER35L

customer_reviews.title: works great, easily cuts copper pipe
customer_reviews.text: Like the compact size and i only had to make a few cuts and it worked perfectly and with its compact size it worked well in the confined space i was in (crawl space up against joists). Would be nice perhaps if it had a color other than gray and black so it was not so easy to lose it in dimly lit crawlspaces.
customer_reviews.author: Idaho

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says it'll do, and does it well.
customer_reviews.text: Good to see that not all companies have moved production offshore. Thank you, Ridgid, for a USA-made 104 that's as good as the one I've been using for the past 10 years.
customer_reviews.author: John A

customer_reviews.title: Perfect! A must have for any do it yourselfer
customer_reviews.text: I love this little thing. I showed 2 friends and they bought it for themselves too. Great for cutting copper, PVC, etc. So easy, my daughter cut the copper pipe (10 years old). You need this little tool in your toolchest if you do any small plumbing projects
customer_reviews.author: Pete I.

customer_reviews.title: High quality
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy and high quality product. Once you fasten the product it stays inline perfectly. Make sure you don’t fasten beyond the limits of your material. Especially the material is hallow. I broke an acrylic pipe but workes great after filling the pipe with another rod.
customer_reviews.author: CaliBear

customer_reviews.title: Cuts pipes, easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Cuts pipes and does so quickly. Easy to use just make sure you know what size pipes you're cutting before you make the purchase almost needed a bigger cutter.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Cuts copper nickel alloy brake lines like butter and the rollers leave a smooth finish on the line.
customer_reviews.author: Mutt

customer_reviews.title: Good for PC Watercooling
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this to cut my tubing in my PETG hardline water cooling builds. I've done quite a few builds now before it's finally started to be noticeably duller.
customer_reviews.author: Chance Conley

customer_reviews.title: Good tool. Blade stayed sharp through multiple cuts through ...
customer_reviews.text: Good tool. Blade stayed sharp through multiple cuts through copper tubing. I even cut 1" diameter aluminum tubing which is greater that the advertised size for this tool, but it worked fine.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin T.Top Contributor: Snowboarding

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful for hard to reach pipe.
customer_reviews.text: Great for all your plumbing needs. I used it to get at some copper piping that was against the sub floor, could not reach it with the normal cutter.
customer_reviews.author: Seth Arnold

customer_reviews.title: Quality tool
customer_reviews.text: Although small, this pipe cutter works great. It's worth getting quality tools
customer_reviews.author: Honolulu Eric

customer_reviews.title: One of the best
customer_reviews.text: I love this pipe cutter. It is small so it’s easy to get into small places. This thing lasts a long time. I have used it a lot and it still cuts great. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: B.Brad

customer_reviews.title: Amazing.
customer_reviews.text: Over the top amazing especially when re-doing brake lines that are extremely close quarters.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality.
customer_reviews.text: Gotta love RIDGID for the quality! The cheap ones went into the recycle bin after using this one.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Moore

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy, works well
customer_reviews.text: A tool like this needs to be sturdy to be used often. Don't put too much pressure on at first, keep turning it and adding a bit more pressure as you go, for the best cut. Great, sturdy, sharp product.
customer_reviews.author: James Coder

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for cutting bike handlebars
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to cut down aluminum handlebars and they worked perfectly in a few seconds. Easy to use and a high quality inexpensive option instead of a guide and hacksaw.
customer_reviews.author: Clayster

customer_reviews.title: Good enough for intermittent use.
customer_reviews.text: This will cut tubing, but is poorly constructed. This is not for professional use.
customer_reviews.author: David C. Sweet

customer_reviews.title: Great in tight spaces
customer_reviews.text: Works great on tight spaces. Cuts right through copper pipes after several tirns.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen W.

customer_reviews.title: Good build quality
customer_reviews.text: I'm glad I spent a little more for this one. It worked like a charm and feels heavy-duty.
customer_reviews.author: Alice WakefieldTop Contributor: Gardening

customer_reviews.title: Excelent tool.
customer_reviews.text: Well worth the extra money you spend versus buying a cheap one. Hasn't missed a cut yet and there have been many of them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It cuts electrical conduit!
customer_reviews.text: I use this to cut 1/2” and 3/4” EMT and PVC. I know it’s a plumbing tool but it’s way easier to cut something that is strapped in place instead of pulling it down and trimming it with my sawzall. It’s not something I use everyday but it really comes in handy in specific situations and works as I expect it to.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan T.

customer_reviews.title: clean
customer_reviews.text: It's a slow cut , compaired to a saw , it's a lot cleaner with NO mess .
customer_reviews.author: phillip hampton

customer_reviews.title: The pipe cutters were crap, leaving the end of the pipe not squared
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased some pipe cutters. Wish I had bought this first. The pipe cutters were crap, leaving the end of the pipe not squared. This left a square edge and smooth. Great item for its price.
customer_reviews.author: Mr B.

customer_reviews.title: Recommend anyone with a handle to hold
customer_reviews.text: I used to cut copper piping work perfectly I have no dislikes
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Length is really about 2 inches.The length in the description is for the package. How dumb is that.
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly on 1/2 and 3/4 inch copper pipe. Was able to work with the pipes very close to joists and parallel pipes. Standard Ridgid tool quality.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Briggs

customer_reviews.title: Worth a few extra bucks to eliminate frustration!!
customer_reviews.text: I've tried the cheaper versions of this type of tube cutter and they always end up trying to thread the copper pipe. This make perfect cuts over and over again. Spend the extra few bucks. I did and I was totally impressed with how perfectly this tool functions.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren R.

customer_reviews.title: Good for tight spaces.
customer_reviews.text: I used this cutter as soon as I received it and am very pleased with it. It fully meets the reputation I expected from a RIDGID tool.
customer_reviews.author: RJ

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great for copper tubing, not so great for soft plastic. It just compressed the tubing, didn't really cut it.
customer_reviews.author: Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: My husband is a plumber and his recently broke so I ordered these for him and he loves them! He swears by Rigid ANYTHING.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Worked great.
customer_reviews.text: Worked like a charm. If you can "rotate" you can cut through cooper pipe (up to the specified size limits).
customer_reviews.author: JohnnyCapsTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Had to cut some pipes in a tight area and worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Irwin Sewake

customer_reviews.title: Love This Mini Cutter
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't skip around when you cut your pipe. The blade is strong. I have used it many times and it hasn't dulled yet. I do wish they would include at least one replacement blade with it for just in case. And apparantly I will be buying another one, because someone decided they needed this more than I did and stole it from me. If it wasn't a Ridgid, they wouldn't of taken it!
customer_reviews.author: Brendon Mize

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great little cutter; like the compact size; good for old work situations.
customer_reviews.author: Ohio Potter

customer_reviews.title: Cuts well
customer_reviews.text: Cuts really well. Great if you just have a few items to cut. If you have many, it'd be time concerning and likely hurt your hands.
customer_reviews.author: M.E.B.Top Contributor: Jewelry Making

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Only had to use it a couple of times so far and has worked great. It is one of the smallest ones out in the market and really strong and "Rigid" hahaha Strong metal base. Not cheap plastics like some other brands. definetly recommend this one. A little pricey but worth it.
customer_reviews.author: H. Granados

customer_reviews.title: Handy tool for tight spaces.
customer_reviews.text: I liked that it worked in close quarters, cut cleanly and kept knuckle busting to a minimum. What’s not to like?
customer_reviews.author: G. E. Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: love the size ....may take a bit longer...but worth it in tight spots
customer_reviews.author: Bobby

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Top quality works great in tight areas all day good tool
customer_reviews.author: D. M. Ing

customer_reviews.title: Does it’s job well.
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm. Small enough to cut in tighter spaces. I cut up to 7/8 copper line without problem.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Good but no boring knife
customer_reviews.text: Good for tight spaces, but unlike most pipe cutters there’s no boring knife for cleaning and boring copper pipe
customer_reviews.author: Matthew deals

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: Quality tool, I should have bough one years ago instead of struggling with junk.
customer_reviews.author: MotownStan

customer_reviews.title: Works like advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Great little cutter, had a small area by my water softener, and I was able to use this to install shark bite fittings.
customer_reviews.author: bpbaumer

customer_reviews.title: works great. Does exactly what it should do
customer_reviews.text: works great. Does exactly what it should do. Good tool
customer_reviews.author: Rockin Momma

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Gets the job done. Precise. Not as flimsy as others I've used
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: great quality and perfect for working in tight spaces to cut copper pipe
customer_reviews.author: Mary Rose

customer_reviews.title: tubing cutter
customer_reviews.text: Ridgid, whats not to like quality. very nice tubing cutter
customer_reviews.author: Roy  Maki Jr

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Cut cooper tube just like it was suppose to. Great product
customer_reviews.author: Kelley Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Never go with anything but Ridgid products!
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfect! I needed it for a small job, and wanted to save some cash. I will never use anything else for cutting small pipe.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Wiese

customer_reviews.title: The only one to buy....
customer_reviews.text: At 63, I've cut lots of copper,,,,,this is the cats meow.
customer_reviews.author: UNACAMPER

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great little cutter, track true and is easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: The Pitcher

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I used it to cut copper pipes in a very hard-to-reach spot in my basement. It took me a few minutes per cut but it all worked out well.
customer_reviews.author: Isaac

customer_reviews.title: No notch on the tool but shown in the picture
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice well made tool. I returned it because I bought it to cut flared ends off of brake tubing. In the picture the wheels are notched so you can cut the flare off close with out wasting to much tubing. In reality this tool has no notch.
customer_reviews.author: M. Nemec

customer_reviews.title: Quality Plumbing Tool
customer_reviews.text: Great cutter that is quality made. I would expect nothing less from the Rigid company. Buy one, you will never regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Boss Hog

customer_reviews.title: Fits in tight places, nice knurling on the knob.
customer_reviews.text: Works well to adjust the length of hard lines fed into a crowded engine bay or wherever you might not have the room for a full-size cutter. In fact, why do you need a full-size cutter for theses little lines at all? Just use this.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Vier

customer_reviews.title: Simple and compact.
customer_reviews.text: Simple and compact. Only problem i had was forgetting to put it back in my tool box from my pocket
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: HVAC
customer_reviews.text: HVAC tools come handy when one have the tools to work
customer_reviews.author: Raul Huerta

customer_reviews.title: Serves its purpose well
customer_reviews.text: Does the job well, cut my 3/4" copper pipe. Takes longer than expected to get through the pipe
customer_reviews.author: DK

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Works great. My contractor has a similar version. After trying to cut with a saw many times I figure I'd buy one of these. Recently had to change some pipes and works awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Golfer 1973

customer_reviews.title: Great pipe cutter
customer_reviews.text: First, I'm a homeowner/DIYer, not a contractor. I've found this pipe cutter to be well made, and effective at cutting pipes. It is especially useful in tight locations. Rigid is a brand I trust for pipe cutters, and this one is no exception. I would definitely recommend this cutter for any close quarters work, to put in your pocket when you need to cut a 10 foot stick in the parking lot to fit it in your car, or it could really work as your primary cutter (for smaller pipe) if you wanted to.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Czop

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: small size is very helpful. Rigid quality is always great
customer_reviews.author: David M. Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good quality tubing cutter. I buy any tool with Rigid on it
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Bedard

customer_reviews.title: Great little tool
customer_reviews.text: Great little tool. Only problem is it is different to photo. Same model number but does not have groove in wheels for the flare.
customer_reviews.author: Kelvyn Watson

customer_reviews.title: Its a little beast
customer_reviews.text: Little in size but does what you need when you need it
customer_reviews.author: Smith

customer_reviews.title: seems sturdy and worked flawless while replacing my brake lines
customer_reviews.text: Cuts clean, seems sturdy and worked flawless while replacing my brake lines..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good toot, sharp blade.
customer_reviews.text: Good tool. Blade is sharp and cuts well in close quarters.
customer_reviews.author: Peter S. Curtis

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for our plumbing repair since it works so well in tight spaces!
customer_reviews.author: Kira Otero

customer_reviews.title: great little cutter
customer_reviews.text: I would definitely recommend this little pipe cutter for any homeowner or do it yourselfer. I bought it to cut copper and pcv to install a water line to my new refrigerator and it worked like a charm. Great for tight spaces and cuts like a pro. Extra blades available but shouldn't need them unless you use it commercially/professionally.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy

customer_reviews.title: Bargain
customer_reviews.text: It's small enough for those tight spots. Most airconditioning units have limited spaces to work with. The price is right for a great little tool.
customer_reviews.author: Edmundo

customer_reviews.title: Very goog cutter
customer_reviews.text: I am not a professional plumber but a very good intermediate level plumber. thanks to you tube and good plumber videos, i have learned how to solder and replaced the entire copper piping with this ridgit cutter. since all the piping was .5", it was more than enough. recommend to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Hadihizlan

customer_reviews.title: Great in tight spaces
customer_reviews.text: This is a tremendous tool for those really tight spaces where the regular pipe cutter won't fit. Really saved me a lot of time in a bathroom renew project.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Total waste of money for me
customer_reviews.text: The description said that it would cut through plastic dowels. Well, all it did was "pinch" it and not cut it. So, it did not work for my needs. I tried to return it, but the seller said that due to the fact that I opened the package, I could not return it. Total waste of money for me.
customer_reviews.author: RAM

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Easy for very tight areas smooth and sharp make the job much easier Ridged makes good tools for the trade
customer_reviews.author: William K Souza

customer_reviews.title: :::::Tubing Cutter.::::
customer_reviews.text: [ tub·ing] [kuht-er] Pros; Cuts tubing precisely Needs little storage room Smells like oil Cons: Poor substitute for facial razor.
customer_reviews.author: Nessmuk's Nephew

customer_reviews.title: It cuts!
customer_reviews.text: It cuts. I used it to cut some 1/4 brake line. Didnt have issues so uhhh idk what else to say. Its priced fair same price you get it for in the orange brick store that sells rigid tools...
customer_reviews.author: Melo

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfect on PVC pipe.
customer_reviews.text: Needed to cut Multiple pieces of PVC pipe. No issues at all.
customer_reviews.author: L’escargot

customer_reviews.title: Contractor choice
customer_reviews.text: Good quality tube cutter. As a contractor this is a great tool.
customer_reviews.author: chris christiansen

product_meta.title: RIDGID 32985 Model 104 Close Quarters Tubing Cutter, 3/16-inch to 15/16-inch Tube Cutter
product_meta.description:
Specially designed for use in restricted spaces on small diameter tubing, the RIDGID 32985 Close Quarters Tubing Cutter makes tight cutting jobs more manageable. Constructed for durability and ease of use, the metal tube cutter features a strong yet lightweight slide and wheel housing and a large knurled feed screw knob that results in clean cuts by ensuring easy control of cutting pressure.

This copper tubing cutter has a 3/16-inch to 15/16-inch cutting capacity and effectively cuts hard and soft copper, aluminum, brass and plastic tubing.

RIDGID covers its products with a lifetime warranty against defects in material or workmanship for the life of the tool.

Since 1923, RIDGID has remained the symbol of certainty to dedicated professionals of the expert trades. Every tool that bears the RIDGID brand is engineered to the same high standards of quality, strength and endurance, as was that first heavy-duty pipe wrench more than 80 years ago.



FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Since 1923, Ridgid has remained the symbol of certainty to dedicated professionals of the expert trades. Every tool that bears the Ridgid brand is engineered to the same high standards of quality, strength and endurance, as was that first heavy-duty pipe wrench more than 80 years ago. Ridgid covers its products with a lifetime warranty against defects in material or workmanship for the life of the tool. The Ridgid 32985 close quarters cutter is specifically designed for use in restricted spaces on hard and soft copper, aluminum, brass and plastic tubing. It has a strong, lightweight slide and wheel housing with a large knurled feed screw knob that gives the user easy control of cutting pressure for cleaner cuts.
feature_bullets: Cuts hard and soft copper, aluminum, brass and plastic tubing
Specifically designed for use on small diameter tubing in restricted spaces
Strong, lightweight slide and wheel housing and large knurled feed screw knob allow easy control of cutting pressure for clean cuts
Tubing cutter has a 3/16-inch to 15/16-inch (5 mm to 24 mm) cutting capacity
RIDGID covers its products with a lifetime warranty against defects in material or workmanship for the life of the tool

specifications.Warranty Description: Ridgid covers its products with a lifetime warranty against defects in material or workmanship for the life of the tool.
